metadata.Title: CVE-2013-0836 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Google V8 before 3.14.5.3, as used in Google Chrome before 24.0.1312.52, does not properly implement garbage collection, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted JavaScript code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-0836` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 24.0.1312.56-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 24.0.1312.56-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 24.0.1312.56-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 24.0.1312.56-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 24.0.1312.56-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mikesalvatore> The Ubuntu Security Team does not support libv8

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '24.0.1312.56-0ubuntu1').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'libv8 not supported').
